alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 28 at 8:54AM AKST until January 29 at 7:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulation of up to 32 inches along the Richardson Highway south of Tonsina. Up to 16 inches of additional snow accumulation on the Edgerton Highway. * WHERE...Southern Copper River Basin, Edgerton Highway and Richardson Highway south of Tonsina. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is expected to be a long duration event persisting into Tuesday at least. Sunday night through Monday morning are going to see up to a foot of snow potentially within a 12-hr period, and up to 36 inches of new snow accumulation possible near the Chugach Mountains along the road system, with higher amounts in the mountains. Highest total snow amounts will be along the Richardson Highway south of Tonsina, with total snow amounts along the Edgerton Highway receiving up to an additional 16 inches. Areas further north between Glennallen and Paxson may see 5 to 10 inches of additional snowfall.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
